function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Incomplete coverage of epidemiological terms in obo bio-ontologies may hinder interoperability and consistency in data representation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Logical inconsistency due to the link between bfo and gfo in the obo landscape may lead to incompatible temporal regions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of the entity-quality eq model or the adaptation of the resources, events, agents rea model for ontology evaluation may introduce semantic and logical complexities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The rise of new variants of the virus that may challenge vaccine efficacy","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of compatible logical model for representing and sharing machine-readable patient monitoring and epidemiology surveillance data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear taxonomy structure for infectious diseases ontology","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reuse of ontological terms and models from existing sources","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of owl 2, a dl-based formalism and semantic web standard for knowledge representation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Building a fair resource for health data and research","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Excluded areas may have different socioeconomic variables, potentially biasing the results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of individual-level socioeconomic data limited detailed study of mechanisms at work.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decrease in testing rate in the most deprived areas signals a deterioration in access to preventive measures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential impact of lockdown on sars-cov-2 outcomes in deprived and less deprived areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variation in sars-cov-2 outcomes according to population density","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Association between social inequalities and differential exposure to the virus, susceptibility to infection, comorbidities, and access to care.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differential sars-cov-2 incidence, positivity rates, and testing rates in socially deprived areas compared to the least deprived areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social gradient in sars-cov-2 incidence and testing likelihood, more pronounced in densely populated socially deprived areas.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of confidence in collective forms of transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low return rate of people who completely gave up public transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Congestion in public transport during rush hours","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unpredictable factors disrupting sustainable mobility culture","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreased use of public transport due to fear of contagion","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift to private vehicles and shared mobility services","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation between feeling of safety and feeling of comfort with willingness to use public transport after the epidemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fear of passengers not following hygienic regimes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding in public transport due to miscalculation","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited or resigned use of public transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fear of infection with covid-19 leading to a shift from public transport to private vehicles.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Feeling less safe using public transport, affecting attitudes and habits towards public transport use.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Factors affecting comfort and safety in public transport during the pandemic, including fear of other passengers not following hygienic measures and tidiness of the vehicle.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in public transport usage due to covid-19 fear and restrictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Switch from stationary work and learning to e-learning and online work","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fear of coronavirus infection leading to limited mobility and social lives","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Passengers declare a majority of factors as important for their comfort in public transport, indicating a potential risk of transmission of contagious diseases from other passengers.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Passengers identify other passengers as a key factor in feeling safe in public transport, suggesting a risk of contagious disease transmission from other passengers.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Existence of cctv systems is deemed least important for feeling safe in public transport, potentially indicating a risk of inadequate surveillance for safety and hygiene practices.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High frequency of public transport usage","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of multiple means of transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low percentage of public transport users for environmental reasons","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Digital technologies for tracking mobility pose privacy and ethical challenges","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Use of public transport during pandemic may lead to increased risk of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pre- and post-pandemic mobility behavior analysis may lead to ineffective solutions if not updated with the latest data and trends","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk-taking attitudes affecting human mobility and social confinement may lead to increased disease spread","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on smartphone user data for epidemic tracking may pose privacy and data security risks","category":"Society","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reduced walking and mobility among women due to pandemic restrictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreased commuting and increased isolation for high-density populations and older subpopulations","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Closure of companies, schools, and shopping centers leading to restricted mobility","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased use of private cars due to safety concerns about public transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dramatic reduction in demand for public transport","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of contagion in public transport impacting lower-income workers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
